externalDocs.description: Find out more about TALQ Consortium

info.description: This is a description of CMS RESTful API. To provide a bidirectional pipeline, the TALQ architecture implements a HTTP server on both the CMS and on the Gateway side. This CMS API can be used by the Gateway to send requests to the CMS.

info.title: TALQ Smart City CMS API

get.description: Get the list of all bracket-types

200.description: The list of all bracket-types

400.description: Request not as defined in the TALQ Specification

post.description: Add a list of new bracket types

parameters.description: Unique request identifier created by the Gateway as client
parameters.name: talqRequestId

parameters.description: Origin request identifier that was created by the CMS as client and caused the current Gateway request
parameters.name: talqOriginRequestId

requestBody.description: The list of bracket types that needs to be added

201.description: The bracket types are successfully created

400.description: Request not as defined in the TALQ Specification

409.description: The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the target resource. This code is used in situations where the CMS might be able to resolve the conflict and resubmit the request. The Gateway SHOULD generate a payload that includes enough information for a CMS to recognize the source of the conflict.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity: The request was well-formed as defined in the TALQ Specification but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

put.description: Update a list of existing bracket types

parameters.description: Unique request identifier created by the Gateway as client
parameters.name: talqRequestId

parameters.description: Origin request identifier that was created by the CMS as client and caused the current Gateway request
parameters.name: talqOriginRequestId

requestBody.description: The list of bracket types that need to be updated

200.description: The bracket types are successfully updated

400.description: Request not as defined in the TALQ Specification

422.description: Unprocessable Entity: The request was well-formed as defined in the TALQ Specification but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

get.description: Get the count of bracket types

200.description: The count of bracket types

400.description: Request not as defined in the TALQ Specification

parameters.description: Unique request identifier created by the Gateway as client
parameters.name: talqRequestId

parameters.description: Origin request identifier that was created by the CMS as client and caused the current Gateway request
parameters.name: talqOriginRequestId

parameters.description: identifier of bracket tye to delete
parameters.name: bracketTypeAddress

200.description: The bracket type is successfully deleted

400.description: Request not as defined in the TALQ Specification

422.description: Unprocessable Entity: The request was well-formed as defined in the TALQ Specification but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors. e.g: the Bracket type is referred by an entity.

get.description: Get the list of all devices, their functions and attributes. Pagination is an optional feature at this operation, and if it is implemented it will be active only when 'offset', 'limit' or both parameters are present, otherwise the whole list of devices must be sent as a response. 'limit' allows the client to set the number of devices returned, while 'offset' specifies the ranking number of the first device on the page, being offset=0 the first device. Pagination requires an implied ordering/indexing, although it is outside TALQ scope and will be the CMS responsibility. When 'limit' is present but 'offset' is not, the result shall start with the first device of the list. If no 'limit' parameter is provided, but only an 'offset', the CMS default limit is used.

parameters.description: Number of devices to skip before beginning to return the result.
parameters.name: offset

200.description: The list of all devices if pagination is not active or the configured number of devices if it is active.

pagination-count.description: Number of devices included in the response

pagination-defaultLimit.description: Default limit if not specified as query parameter

pagination-offset.description: Number of devices skipped on the complete list

pagination-totalCount.description: Total number of devices present in the server

400.description: Request not as defined in the TALQ Specification

patch.description: Partial update of a list of existing devices. Partially updates the existing device definition. For the function array each element passed in will be cross-referenced against items in the existing function array using the id. If they match, the existing function will be updated. If there is no match the function will be added. To remove functions from the array see PUT, where an empty or reduced function array can be passed in.

parameters.description: Unique request identifier created by the Gateway as client
parameters.name: talqRequestId

parameters.description: Origin request identifier that was created by the CMS as client and caused the current Gateway request
parameters.name: talqOriginRequestId

requestBody.description: The list of device that need to be updated

200.description: The list of device is successfully updated

400.description: Request not as defined in the TALQ Specification

422.description: Unprocessable Entity: The request was well-formed as defined in the TALQ Specification but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

post.description: Add a list of new devices

parameters.description: Unique request identifier created by the Gateway as client
parameters.name: talqRequestId

parameters.description: Origin request identifier that was created by the CMS as client and caused the current Gateway request
parameters.name: talqOriginRequestId

requestBody.description: The list of devices that needs to be added

400.description: Request not as defined in the TALQ Specification

409.description: The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the target resource. This code is used in situations where the Gateway might be able to resolve the conflict and resubmit the request. The CMS SHOULD generate a payload that includes enough information for a Gateway to recognize the source of the conflict.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity: The request was well-formed as defined in the TALQ Specification but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

put.description: Update a list of existing devices. Replaces the entire existing device definition. For the function array this will mean the existing device functions will be replaced with those specified in this call.

parameters.description: Unique request identifier created by the Gateway as client
parameters.name: talqRequestId

parameters.description: Origin request identifier that was created by the CMS as client and caused the current Gateway request
parameters.name: talqOriginRequestId

requestBody.description: The list of device that need to be updated

200.description: The list of devices is successfully updated

400.description: Request not as defined in the TALQ Specification

422.description: Unprocessable Entity: The request was well-formed as defined in the TALQ Specification but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

parameters.description: Unique request identifier created by the Gateway as client
parameters.name: talqRequestId

parameters.description: Origin request identifier that was created by the CMS as client and caused the current Gateway request
parameters.name: talqOriginRequestId

200.description: The device is successfully deleted

400.description: Request not as defined in the TALQ Specification

422.description: Unprocessable Entity: The request was well-formed as defined in the TALQ Specification but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors. e.g.: the device is referred by an entity.

get.description: Get a single device by TALQ address

200.description: The found device

400.description: Request not as defined in the TALQ Specification

patch.description: Partially updates the existing device definition. For the function array each element passed in will be cross-referenced against items in the existing function array using the id. If they match, the existing function will be updated. If there is no match the function will be added. For each function, only the attributes passed in will be updated in the existing function.

parameters.description: Unique request identifier created by the Gateway as client
parameters.name: talqRequestId

parameters.description: Origin request identifier that was created by the CMS as client and caused the current Gateway request
parameters.name: talqOriginRequestId

requestBody.description: The device that need to be updated

200.description: The device is successfully updated

400.description: Request not as defined in the TALQ Specification

422.description: Unprocessable Entity: The request was well-formed as defined in the TALQ Specification but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

parameters.name: talqOriginRequestId
